examples: Sleep well and sweet dreams.
The wedding celebrations went like a dream.
Many actors dream of winning prestigious awards for their performances.
A few weeks later, I landed my dream job.
Our dream destination for this year's vacation is a secluded tropical island.
words.defineEn: a series of images, feelings, or events happening in one's mind during sleep
words.defineVi: một loạt hình ảnh, cảm giác hoặc sự kiện xảy ra trong tâm trí của một người trong khi ngủ

examples: I woke up with the mother of all hangovers.
They usually wake up at 7 o'clock on weekdays.
She woke up and found herself in a hospital bed.
We woke up early and took a dip in the sea before breakfast.
I wake up early every morning to go for a run.
words.defineEn: to no longer be asleep
words.defineVi: không còn buồn ngủ

examples: His voice dropped to a whisper.
Liam whispered sweet nothings into Jane's ear, making her blush and smile.
The old man looked at his wife of 50 years and whispered, 'To me, your beauty is only growing stronger with time.
The policeman whispered in Felix’s ear.
The word whispered round the Opera House.
words.defineEn: to speak very softly or quietly, usually to avoid being overheard by others who are nearby
words.defineVi: nói rất nhẹ nhàng hoặc lặng lẽ, thường là để tránh bị những người khác ở gần nghe thấy

examples: lose that creep!
These child abductions are giving me the creeps.
The memory of all that blood made his flesh creep.
I crept out of bed in the dead of night and sneaked downstairs.
It gets as silent as the grave at nighttime, and it really creeps me out.
words.defineEn: to move slowly and quietly while staying close to the ground or other surface
words.defineVi: di chuyển chậm và lặng lẽ trong khi ở gần mặt đất hoặc bề mặt khác

examples: Get out!
Word got out about the surprise party, and it wasn't a surprise anymore.
A car drives up, and a man gets out.
A car drove up to us and a man got out.
A fool may throw a stone into a well which a hundred wise men cannot get out.
words.defineEn: to leave somewhere such as a room, building, etc.
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một nơi nào đó chẳng hạn như một căn phòng, tòa nhà, vv

examples: She sent the kids to bed early.
The price includes dinner, bed, and breakfast.
The sofa had to serve as a bed.
I have a bedside table next to my bed for my books and glasses.
I usually go to bed around 11 o'clock.
words.defineEn: furniture we use to sleep on that normally has a frame and mattress
words.defineVi: đồ nội thất chúng ta sử dụng để ngủ thường có khung và nệm

examples: His parents are always breathing down his neck.
I could barely breathe it was so funny.
My sister lives and breathes her yoga practice.
She eats, sleeps, and breathes painting.
As I live and breathe!
words.defineEn: to take air into one's lungs and let it out again
words.defineVi: để lấy không khí vào phổi của một người và cho nó ra một lần nữa

examples: The children were all sitting quietly and listening.
I was in Vienna sitting quietly in a café when, lo and behold, my cousin walked in.
We all sat sipping our tea quietly, no one wanting to bring up the white elephant in the room about Joel's expulsion from college.
the doctor asked Mr. Rinaldi quietly.
Quietly, their boat moved nearer.
words.defineEn: in a manner that makes very little or no noise
words.defineVi: theo cách mà làm cho rất ít hoặc không có tiếng ồn

examples: A beautiful white horse grazed peacefully in the meadow.
The 1,400 fans were on their best behavior and filed out peacefully at the end.
We were lucky to witness a herd of elephants grazing peacefully in the savannah.
Catherine's dead body lay peacefully on her bed.
The election had unfolded relatively peacefully.
words.defineEn: in a calm and harmonious manner
words.defineVi: một cách bình tĩnh và hài hòa

examples: Suddenly another soldier hits the dirt beside me.
My father died suddenly at the age of 48.
A man suddenly appeared from behind a tree.
Quite suddenly, her mind was made up.
Suddenly things started happening.
words.defineEn: quickly and unexpectedly
words.defineVi: một cách nhanh chóng và bất ngờ

examples: Mary's makeup was applied so heavily that it looked like she had a face that could stop a clock.
The company's decision to invest heavily in the new product was a kill or cure move.

The company that relies too heavily on a single product or service may be vulnerable to market changes or competition, demonstrating how the pitcher goes so often to the well that it is broken at last.
In a business environment, a playing field which is heavily regulated and favors established companies can make it challenging for new startups to compete and thrive.
Islamic narratives heavily influenced the perception of jinn and their characteristics.
words.defineEn: in large amounts or to a great degree
words.defineVi: với số lượng lớn hoặc ở mức độ lớn

examples: I asked urgently.
Governor Cockburn sought help urgently, advice from London, from downing Street.
You urgently seek another relationship as a source of care and support when a close relationship ends.
Now number seven, 'Urgently seeks another relationship as a source of care and support,' 'When one close relationship ends.'
Most urgently, it's also supplementing efforts by the government to get food to people.
words.defineEn: in manner or situation that requires prompt action or attention due to its pressing nature
words.defineVi: theo cách thức hoặc tình huống đòi hỏi phải có hành động hoặc sự chú ý nhanh chóng do tính chất cấp bách của nó

examples: The days passed slowly.
The day and night passed slowly.
The blades of the helicopter were turning slowly.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
He slowly raised his head up.
words.defineEn: moving or doing something at a slow speed; not quickly
words.defineVi: di chuyển hoặc làm điều gì đó với tốc độ chậm; không nhanh chóng

examples: Our waiter cleared the empty plates from the table.
The coast is clear.
Sanskrit inscriptions are clear as day.
The house rules are crystal clear.
The answers came back clear as a bell.
words.defineEn: easy to understand
words.defineVi: dễ hiểu

examples: That ship of yours clearly has had her day.
The photographs clearly show a broken window.
That resolution clearly withered on the vine.
She was clearly speaking the truth.
The witness was clearly lying through his teeth.
words.defineEn: with no doubt
words.defineVi: không có nghi ngờ

examples: We ate dinner in a noisy café.
The teacher took the student out of the noisy classroom to have a private conversation.
The party was ruined by a couple of noisy, rude gate-crashers.
Despite his wealth and fame, he often feels outside noisy, inside empty, longing for something more meaningful in his life.
We are so noisy!
words.defineEn: making or having of a lot of unwanted sounds
words.defineVi: tạo ra hoặc có nhiều âm thanh không mong muốn

examples: She turned a page noisily.
He never stops hitting it noisily, hour after hour.
words.defineEn: in a way that makes too much sound or disturbance
words.defineVi: trong một cách mà làm cho quá nhiều âm thanh hoặc xáo trộn

examples: Careful planning laid the foundations for the nation’s economic miracle.
Be careful with your actions.
Be extra careful with this one.
Do be careful, for goodness' sake.
If you cannot be good, be careful.
words.defineEn: giving attention or thought to what we are doing to avoid doing something wrong, hurting ourselves, or damaging something
words.defineVi: chú ý hoặc suy nghĩ về những gì chúng ta đang làm để tránh làm sai, làm tổn thương bản thân hoặc làm hỏng thứ gì đó

examples: The chef carefully arranged the arugula leaves on the plate as a beautiful garnish.
The child carefully planted caryopses of wildflowers in the garden.
The lioness carefully groomed her newborn baby.
Please drive carefully.
She carefully sprinkled sunflower seeds on top of her homemade bread dough.
words.defineEn: with a lot of care or attention
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều quan tâm hoặc chú ý

examples: Knowledge of cooking comes easy to him.
The whole procedure is as easy as ABC.
A ramp allows easy access for wheelchairs.
Using the camera was as easy as pie.
It's an easy exam.
words.defineEn: needing little skill or effort to do or understand
words.defineVi: cần ít kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để làm hoặc hiểu

examples: That kick of yours could have easily made mincemeat of my face.
Ciphers are easily broken by the new wonder machines.
Memorizing important dates in history came easily to him in school.
He picked up the new language easily by listening to podcasts.
Booksellers should easily be able to move this biography of Lincoln.
words.defineEn: with no problem or difficulty
words.defineVi: không có vấn đề hoặc khó khăn

examples: The construction project was completed without a hitch, thanks to the hard work of our team and the diligence of our contractors.
Thanksgiving is never complete without the aroma of a succulent turkey.
Tacos aren't complete without a generous amount of grated cheese on top.
They made complete pigs of themselves at the dinner.
Please return the completed form at your earliest convenience.
words.defineEn: having all the necessary parts
words.defineVi: có tất cả các bộ phận cần thiết

examples: The explanation went completely over my head.
My mouth felt completely dry.
The death of his wife broke him completely.
The death of his wife broke him completely.
The millstone around my neck is choking me completely.
words.defineEn: to the greatest amount or extent possible; fully
words.defineVi: với số lượng hoặc mức độ lớn nhất có thể; đầy đủ

examples: The food looks good.
Good wine can make a meal.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
This information is as good as gold.
"Your guess is as good as mine."
words.defineEn: having a standard or quality that is satisfying
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn hoặc chất lượng thỏa mãn

examples: The horse took the first fence well.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
The glue is taking well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
words.defineEn: in a way that is right, good, or satisfactory
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là đúng, tốt, hoặc thỏa đáng

examples: Bad weather brought chaos to the utility companies.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
The bad weather brought famine.
Don’t use bad language.
Bad manners will get you nowhere.
words.defineEn: having a standard or quality that is unsatisfying
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn hoặc chất lượng không thỏa mãn

examples: They both pay their employees badly.
This company badly needs to bring in some new blood.
The evening started badly when the speaker failed to turn up.
We've done very badly as far as planning is concerned.
Jack vented his spleen at his wife whenever things went badly at work.
words.defineEn: to a great or serious degree or extent
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ lớn hoặc nghiêm trọng hoặc mức độ

examples: Learning a new language can be a daunting task, but by practicing a little every day, you'll make steady progress, and eventually, little strokes fell great oaks, and you'll be fluent.
The teacher, Jacob's teacher is fluent in ASL.
I'm not fluent.
I'm fluent in English.
I'm not fluent.
words.defineEn: capable of using a language easily and properly
words.defineVi: có khả năng sử dụng một ngôn ngữ một cách dễ dàng và đúng cách

examples: Although she didn't speak the language fluently, she was able to get by with basic phrases and gestures.
He wants to become bilingual and speak multiple languages fluently.
Of course, not all deaf people can read English fluently.
It merges fluently with outer space, where there's no atmosphere at all.
People's opinions sway one way and ignore people who aren’t signing fluently.
words.defineEn: in an easy, effortless, and correct manner
words.defineVi: một cách dễ dàng, dễ dàng và chính xác

examples: The children happily enjoyed their aspartame-sweetened popsicles on a hot summer day.
The children played happily under the sun.
The goldfish in the bowl was swimming around happily.
They happily raised their glasses for a toast.
The birds are chirping happily outside the window.
words.defineEn: with cheerfulness and joy
words.defineVi: với sự vui vẻ và niềm vui

words.defineEn: in a manner that reflects a sense of wrongdoing or being at fault
words.defineVi: theo cách phản ánh cảm giác sai trái hoặc có lỗi

examples: The bedside radio played softly.
The white snowflakes were falling softly from the sky during winter.
I speak softly and carry a big stick to maintain a peaceful atmosphere.
He sat in the corner, playing softly on his guitar.
Even though I was speaking very softly, Jill could read my lips and knew exactly what I was saying.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is gentle and pleasant
words.defineVi: một cách nhẹ nhàng và dễ chịu

examples: Sadly, new customers are being enticed by tempting promotions only to find the dice are loaded against them.
"The good die young," said the pastor sadly at Robert's funeral, for even at the age of 80, his kindness, faith and generosity made his passing feel far too soon.
I hired Jess only because she thinks quick on her feet, an attribute that you sadly do not possess.
She should have known better than to trust him again after he had already betrayed her once, yet sadly it is a silly fish that is caught twice with the same bait.
because, sadly, the groom died.
words.defineEn: used to express that something is sad, regrettable, or unfortunate
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện rằng một cái gì đó là buồn, đáng tiếc, hoặc không may

examples: During February, the days gradually start getting longer as we move closer to spring.
After the CEO announced that she had been diagnosed with dementia, her daughter gradually began taking the reins of the company.
He used to be an important member of the team, but he's gradually drifted out of the picture.
The tension and excitement built gradually all day.
The sky gradually brightened as the morning sun rose.
words.defineEn: slowly and in small amounts over a long period of time; not suddenly
words.defineVi: chậm và với số lượng nhỏ trong một thời gian dài; không đột ngột

examples: Sales are growing fast.
Things certainly move fast in the blogosphere.
He takes bends much too fast.
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
He's going too fast.
words.defineEn: having a high speed when moving or doing something
words.defineVi: có tốc độ cao khi di chuyển hoặc làm gì đó

examples: This disaster comes hard on the heels of last week’s train crash.
The kids always work hard at school.
For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.
Life on the road can be very hard.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: with a lot of difficulty or effort
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều khó khăn hoặc nỗ lực

examples: The library closes early on Sundays.
She sent the kids to bed early.
Her early research laid the foundation for many important medical discoveries.
Book early and save £50!
For some people, early morning jogging is their cup of tea.
words.defineEn: before the usual or expected time
words.defineVi: trước thời gian thông thường hoặc dự kiến
